intro: Struthanthus diversifolius, commonly known as the desert star. It is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central disk, blooming in late spring. Struthanthus diversifolius is adapted to extreme drought conditions, making it a hardy species in desert environments.
